alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 10:57AM CST until December 25 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow, with visibility a half mile or less at times on some roads. Worst travel conditions on Friday. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Crow Wing, Northern Aitkin, South Aitkin and Pine Counties. In Wisconsin, Burnett County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Mille Lacs Band, Big Sandy Lake, Lena Lake, Hinckley and, East Lake areas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and Friday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause tree damage resulting in power outages in cold weather. Periods of whiteout conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin
